segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to identify a single project cost reporting document category, its unique identifier, and specific message function.
PRI, A segment to identify contract pricing details including the monetary unit of measure for all monetary amounts in the message.
CUX, A segment to identify the currencies relevant to all monetary amounts in the message.
ATT, A segment to identify the contract type, program type, and security level notation.
MOA, A segment to identify total contract monetary amounts such as the negotiated cost, contract ceiling, and target price.
PCD, A segment to identify total contract percentages such as target fee or profit percentage or share ratio percentages when there is a contract cost overrun.
DTM, A segment to identify total contract dates such as the contract start date, last time delivery date, or contract completion date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to provide information about the project, and to identify unique reference numbers for the message along with any related descriptions.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify reference numbers related to the project such as a program, contract, contract addendum, or contract data requirements list.
IMD, A segment to provide a description of a reference number, such as a program name or contract name.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to provide information about the item under contract such as how many items are being built or delivered, a description, characteristics, and related attributes.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to provide the quantity of item(s) being built or delivered under a contract.
IMD, A segment to provide a description of the item(s) being built or delivered under a contract.
CCI, A segment to provide characteristic details for the item(s) being built or delivered under a contract.
ATT, A segment to provide program type information such as research and development phase or production phase for the item(s) being built or delivered under a contract.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify the parties relevant to the entire message with related contact and communication information.

segment.documentation: PNA, A segment to provide message sender and receiver information.
ADR, A segment to provide address information for each named party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify the contact, communication numbers, and related dates for each named party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide an authorized representative or contact person's name and department for each named party.
COM, A segment to identify the phone number, fax number, e-mail, or other communication number for the contact party.
DTM, A segment to identify dates associated with the authorized representative such as approved and submission dates.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to provide information about other documents or files that related to the entire message such as schedule, technical, text, or graphical files that provide additional project reference or management control information. Also provides details about the computing environment and related dates if needed.

segment.documentation: EFI, A segment to identify a related file or message along with details, such as the file name, file format, version, and data format.
CED, A segment to describe the data processing environment used to create the named file such as the name of the software application, version and release.
DTM, A segment to provide the created, effective, processing, or other date stamp for the named file. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to convey the report line item information (level one) and reporting structure (level two) cost and hour details. At the report line item level, provides segments to identify which report format, contract funding and appropriation notations, and period grouping details for contracts that span many years. At the reporting structure level, provides segments to identify additional information, reference numbers, and cost and hour details.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment used to identify the specific report line item and format the data represents. Generally relates to specific contractual data items required for the receiving customer. May use an external code list to identify the reporting line item, generally for a specific government entity.
ATT, A segment used at the report level to identify contract funding and appropriation information specific to a given report.
DTM, A segment used at the report level to provide specific report start and stop dates or funds effective dates.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments used at the report level to describe the out- year time frames used to condense time phased reporting details for contracts that span many years.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify the out-year period reference number.
QTY, A segment to identify the number of reporting periods condensed into one out-year period reference.
DTM, A segment used to identify the span of dates condensed into one out-year period reference.
IMD, A segment to provide a description of the condensed out-year period reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: SG11-SG12-SG13 A group of segments to provide reporting structure element codes, relationship information, descriptions, conditions, characteristics about the work item, other reference numbers, dates, responsible person contact information, statistical information, and associated costs and quantities. Also describes the lower level cost element details (level three) for each reporting structure along with associated statistics, costs, and quantities.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment to identify the type of reporting structure such as a work breakdown or organizational breakdown, and structure element code.
REL, A segment to identify the reporting structure element code relationship details such as a significant or non-significant reporting structure.
IMD, A segment to provide a description for the reporting structure code or to provide an item characteristic reference.
RCS, A segment to provide condition information about the reporting structure element, such as recurring, non- recurring, add, and non-add.
CCI, A segment to provide information about a product or assembly associated with a reporting structure element.
RFF, A segment to provide reference numbers associated with a reporting structure element, such as appropriation number, contract line item number, or statement of work number.
DTM, A segment to provide contract period and funding start and stop dates.
STA, A segment to provide technical performance measurement statistics associated with a reporting structure element.
FTX, A segment to provide additional text for the reporting structure element. Generally used to provide additional details about baseline changes or problem resolution.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to provide a responsible person's name and communication numbers for the reporting structure element.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide a responsible person's name and department.
COM, A segment to identify the phone number, fax number, e-mail, or other communication number for the responsible person.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to provide monetary amounts associated with a reporting structure element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to provide monetary amounts, such as budget, earned value, actual, budget at complete, and estimate at complete.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time phased monetary amounts.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to provide quantities associated with a reporting structure element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to provide hour or working month quantities such as budget, earned value, actual, budget at complete, and estimate at complete.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time phased quantity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to provide percentages associated with a reporting structure element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to provide percentages such as technical performance measurement metrics or cost fees.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time based percentages.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to identify cost element details associated with a reporting structure element. Provides segments to describe the cost element and associated statistics, costs, and quantities.

segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to provide a characteristic value of a cost element in coded form such as labor, material, other direct costs, or subcontract costs. Can be adapted to identify standard cost elements for any given industry sector.
PRC, A segment to identify a specific functional process, such as engineering or manufacturing.
IMD, A segment to provide a description of the cost element.
RFF, A segment to provide reference numbers for the cost element, such as a cost account or work package number.
DTM, A segment to provide start and stop dates for the cost element.
STA, A segment to provide technical performance measurement statistics associated with a cost element.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to provide monetary amounts associated with a cost element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to provide monetary amounts, such as budget, earned value, actual, budget at complete, and estimate at complete.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time phased monetary amounts.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to provide quantities associated with a cost element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to provide hour or working month quantities, such as budget, earned value, actual, budget at complete, and estimate at complete.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time phased quantity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to provide percentages associated with a cost element and any related dates.

segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to provide percentages such as technical performance measurement metrics or cost fees.
DTM, A segment to provide start and end dates for any time based percentages. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
CNT, A segment to provide control totals for the message, such as the total number of reporting structure elements.
